text: This place is the absolutely best, most convenient, most well-located market I've ever patronized.
Delicious subs at a supremely reasonable price. The vibe of the store and its employees is A+ also
Just a corner store! Nothing special and dont have a lot of the stuff i really like. Just two stars.

Ever since I moved to Madison from Ann Arbor the one thing I've been missing is a true deli.... Until I found Pinkus McBride! This place has great sandwiches.  It's a walk-up and create your own sandwich place.  Fresh hoagie rolls or other breads, lots of topping options, and even other deli sides.  I will be returning for all of my deli cravings.  Nothing else like this in town.

I love pinkus!  But just so you guys know your online store hours are not accurate.  I just tried to come purchase something and the store was not open even though it says you guys are open until midnight? Pretty disappointing... You guys should probably have accurate information posted online...
A girlfriend always brings over some of their homemade ice cream and it is SOOO satisfying!

Visited for a quick grab and go lunch. Poor signage (i did not see how/where to order a fresh sandwich) and not one of the 2 people behind the deli counter so much as said hello, although we were all less than 2 feet from each other.  Bought a Pesto Ham sandwich, made on a take and bake parisian roll (not impressed) which was obviously made long ago, as the bread had that soggy "yesterdays sandwich" taste. $5.49.  Macaroni salad was sub par $2.99 for 8oz. Add a bottle of pop and I had lunch for just under $11.  I have seen better food at a job site off a "roach coach"  Cute store, nice location, food at half the price would still be a disappointment.  It's a shame since Boar's Head usually does a better job of training locations that carry their items how a sandwich should taste!

The store around the corner a bit more towards the capitol on E Mifflin and Hancock (I think it's Market Basket) has a better selection and will actually care about you as a customer. I purchased something behind the counter at Pinkus and was given the wrong item by the clerk. When I tried to return it, I was told a tab was off (eve though the product was sealed) and they wouldn't take it back, give it store credit, or anything. I won't be shopping there anymore. At Market Basket they have a better beer selection and even a pad so you can request items you want. They will treat you better there and you will find a better selection, they are only missing a deli but Gotham bagels is right there.

It's a pretty generic small grocery, but the sandwiches are awesome. None of them are like in your face delicious, but after eating one, you feel satisfied and may just say "dang, that was a good sandwich."
Over priced and anything from the deli just doesn't taste right

As Michael said, what's really great about this corner store is that its a block up from James Madison Park, so you could just ease on down the way for a soda or ice cream break on nice Summer days when you are working the park.
Always a good place to get snacks, bread, coffee or sandwiches.  Good location, clean.
Great sandwiches and deli selection, friendly employees.

Love Pinkus!  I'm biased living right next door to it, but in addition to typical corner-store fare (snacks, drinks, frozen food), they also have great sandwiches and snack-size pasta dishes prepared everyday.  Go here almost every day but I'll also stop by when I'm missing something I need to make a meal with or for another case of PBR at 855pm.

I work just a couple blocks away from Pinkus McBride Market, so I go there often to grab lunch/snacks.  Keep in mind that this is a very small corner market with limited space. However, for such a small space, they do have a great selection of essentials. They have lots of snack food, frozen foods, a nice selection of dairy products, etc.  The deli area is the highlight though. They make delicious sandwiches, using quality ingredients. The deli uses Boar's Head meat, which is excellent. They also make a variety of great pasta salads. Oh, and they have really good carrot cake!!  Everyone who works there is super friendly and helpful. As others have mentioned, they do have a nice little selection of beer and wine. Everything at Pinkus McBride is pretty affordable.   If you live/work nearby, I'd highly recommend checking it out!

The coolest corner store in all of the world. First of all the owner named the place after his dachshund. Who has a dog named Pinkus McBride? Only the coolest person ever. And there is a small fairy who lives in the deli that makes the most magical sandwiches in the country. And the place always has the hipsters working there with great music blaring through the door. An essential stop before going to look at the scantily clad women in James Madison Park.

I work down Hamilton near this market.  For a day when you forget your lunch, Pinkus McBride can certainly be a lifesaver.  The service is nice and they have a great selection of food.  I am just not impressed by the prices.  They know they are the only place in the area and take advantage of that.  I get it, supply and demand, but please, just bring it down a bit.  I pay more money for a sandwich there than I would at a fast food restaurant.  I get the quality is better but the temperature is much hotter at the restaurant.  The breakfast sandwiches are on bagels or muffins with eggs, bacon or ham and cheese.  They have a full deli and a small convenience store.  If you forget lunch or breakfast, this is the place to be.  I am quite overwhelmed by the deli.  I could not figure out the prices or how to order a sandwich.  It took some help to walk me through it.  A deli should not require help.  I do not want to speak ill of Pinkus but I know their prices have pushed people away.  I found myself heading up the opposite way to Bradbury's (reviewed below) for a $1.80 cup of coffee.    Oh, Pinkus, we will always have a love/hate relationship.

It's just a corner store, but they've nailed it.  Prices are fair. Selection is good. They have a legit deli with good sandwiches.   They sell a pretty good selection of beer. If you're in Wisconsin and not drinking beer, you've missed the boat.  Great alternative to a grocery store (since there are none within a mile).

Great corner store that's very convenient to James Madison Park. They have a good deli (sandwiches are less than $6 and they have sprouts!!!) and a nice selection of drinks (including wine and beer) and snacks (desserts are the bomb). The employees are nice. Go here!

I have another market super close to me, but I go out of my way to go to Pinkus. They have the nicest employees, solid prices, and a good selection of reasonably priced beer/wine. Also, their brownies and bars are surprisingly the BEST I have had in Madison.

Pinkus McBride is a short walk from my apartamente, and they sell all one needs when needing to make a "quick stop."  They are superbly clean, look brand new, and have some of the most friendly employees around.    I love how close Pinkus is to my place, it truly is a convenience store for me, in every sense of the term.    For as long as I am part of this neighborhood Pinkus McBride will have my business.  And how cute is it that the owner named the place after his dog?!  Awwwww

Pinkus is absolutely awesome. They have absolutely amazing homemade subs and some of the best chocolate cake I've ever had. They also have pretty much everything else you'd expect a convenience store to have and a whole lot more. The deli there is great as well

Pinkus McBride and I were BFF's while I lived in Madison because it was literally directly across the street from my apartment. I am not going to lie, it is a little bit on the pricey side, but ultra convenient. Although the food items are a little expensive, they have really, really cheap wine. (I bought some for a shindig I threw) When I was too lazy to prepare food myself I bought subs here...they were about $5 and what you would expect as a sub from a corner store. They were never soggy.

I rate Pinkus only two stars for this reason: it wasn't the grocery store I had hoped. I did my research (yelped and googled Pinkus McBride Market), read the reviews, and decided to forgo Fresh Market on University and give Pinkus a shot. The location is unbeatable - a block from my apartment - and it really is a cute, little place.   However, the selection for general grocery items such as cereal, noodles, rice, and yogurt was small and a bit pricey. I knew about the higher prices, but I was sad about not finding a convenient grocery store so close to my place.   The deli was closed, but I did buy an Italian sub that brought me much joy on my lunch break -- the olives were a splendid compliment to the meat. I will definitely go back when the deli is open because of fellow yelpers' reviews. I wasn't beer or wine shopping, but there was a better selection than what I was searching for. The staff was also very friendly.   Again, the two stars may be unfair to Pinkus McBride Market as a whole, but for my desire to find a viable grocery store, it fits. Will rate again once I visit the deli --
Great deli, produce, and bakery selection. Staff is friendly! Very large selection and reasonable prices. Short walk from capitol square.

Theeee best corner store in the whole US of A.   Delicious yet cheap subs and deli foods that are maintained with the highest of quality. Everything is very tasty and very fresh. You can tell a lot of care and thought has been put into these foods. Even the day old subs rock, and you can't beat the half off price tag with a stick.   Since the Isthmus is completely devoid of any hint of a grocery store, this was my go-to spot for sundries and sustenance for 5 whole years because I had no car, thought Cap Center was a joke, and couldn't afford Willy Street Co-op. It didn't hurt that a 12 pack of Blatz was $4.25 including tax and all the kind folks working treated me like a queen.

I'm reading these reviews and thinking some of y'all need to read up on what a "convenience store" is...if you're expecting a supermarket selection and walmart prices, then it's nobody's fault but your own when you're disappointed.   I live right next door to Pinkus. They always have what I need when I'm cooking and realize I'm out of that *one* ingredient, be it an onion or a bottle or Worcestershire  sauce. They also have a great wine selection and a whole bevy of snacks and desserts to satisfy any corner store cravings.  Perfect place to stop before, after, or during a trip to the park!

I visit Pinkus quite often and the staff behind the counter is super nice. My main complaint is that the deli always closes early. It's supposed to close at 7, not 5:50. The place also closes early pretty frequently too.

This is my go-to convenient store, and they always seem to have what I need at the time. The staff is super friendly, and deli sandwiches are also great. I love that it's right next to the lake, so it's a perfect place to get ice cream and chill out in the sun.

I love how there is a conscience store so close to where I live! It is the perfect location, and I love how late they are open. The weekdays they are open until 11 pm, and on the weekends they are open until midnight!   They have all the essentials someone would need if they were in a pinch! From frozen foods to snack, alcohol to cigarettes, premade foods to cleaning supplies, they have what you would need! They have saved my life so many times when I have ran out of body wash or trash bags; it's ridiculous!   They have also a great staff of people who are friendly and down to earth. I love it here!

This place is MY JAM. Seriously. I live right near it, but honestly would come back even if I didn't. Awesome deli sandwiches (fresh made bread, I believe!!), pre made breakfast sandwiches every morning, tons of wine and beer options, and lots of fresh pastries and dinner options - not to mention the fun staff and vibe. Love this place!
Best little corner store in town! They have a good selection for its store size and the price is not too bad

Man, this place is great.   They have a good selection of typical corner store items - snacks, drinks, grocery items, booze, etc. but the real treasure lies in their sandwiches - SO GOOD. For less than 5 dollars you get your choice of bread, two kinds of meat, cheese, veggies, and multiple sauces. Everything is high quality and definitely worth more than what you pay. They also have an excellent selection of cookies (top notch monster cookies), pastries,  and deli salads.   Also, everyone is super friendly and it is clean. Bonus points for being on the way home from class!

We were visiting Madison and came in on a Saturday for the Farmers Market at the Capitol.  What a zoo!  State Street was closed for a street fair as well, and all the streets are one way, so we were having a heck of a time getting around.  Lost and hungry, we stumbled on this deli, just a block from the lake and park.  A great find.  Boar's Head meats, made to order sandwiches, a really good deviled egg potato salad, and fresh, not too chewy rolls.  Prices were reasonable.  Service was helpful and friendly.

I live right next to PInkus and so I am a frequent customer. They have a lot of essentials you run out of (or forget to buy) - everything from lemons, limes, and other produce to flour and sugar for baking. All of those things though are very overpriced - we once spent $5 on Oreos. Beer and wine are a good deal however.   Their sandwiches are awesome - lots of selection of cheese, sauces, spreads, and meats, and all at a fair price. Thank god for Pinkus.

My ex used to live in the converted church across the street from Pinkus. It became a regular stop on my visits, if only for their scotcharoo-style peanut butter and chocolate bars. Staff was always really friendly and it was fantastic to just run across the street for a sandwich or mixers for a party. It's probably more expensive but I feel much better paying for convenience here than 7-11.

It's weird to rave about a corner "minute market" store, but this one is pretty tight.  Besides having a baller selection of beer (the only place I can find Wild Blue in Madison), it's convenient and well-priced for the James Madison neighborhood.  They also have some fresh food which is a little pricier, but always delicious.  The staff is nice and they take credit cards! Go here!
This was the place that made me realize that they don't sell alcohol after 9pm in Wisconsin. That's it. That's my review.

If you live on the east side of Downtown Madison, take note: this is the only place to pick up the Times on a Sunday morning.    Seriously, I buy three things at this place: mixers, beer, and the NY Times.  The best cornerstore in walking distance of my apartment.

I am a big fan of Pinkus. If you live in, or frequent, the James Madison area this is such an easy go-to for almost anything.   Beer, wine, snacks, sandwiches. They always have a large selection of deli creations and salads. The pasta salads are DELISH!! I definitely recommend.    It is not a grocery store, so it obviously isn't going to have shelf after shelf of options, but for a small corner-store it really does have a lot to offer. Candy, chips, dry goods, aspirins and other OTC meds, pet food. All the things you might need in a pinch or that you forgot when you went to the actual grocery store and now don't feel like driving all the way back for. Very convenient.   And the staff has always been super friendly and chatty. Love this place!

For the past 3 months I have stopped into Pinkus every morning to pick up my lunch, breakfast, and snack for the day. Whenever I have arrived the older gentleman behind the counter has been VERY friendly, he evens knows me by my first name. If you go early enough they have half-priced subs and salads that taste amazing, it is a real steal. Besides deli foods they have a huge beverage section that includes wine and beer. The beer section has an excellent variety of quality brew which is hard to find in a store of this size. The layout and appearance of the store is top notch so don't expect long bouts of searching for what you need. Overall, I would go nowhere else to start my day than Pinkus McBride!
